title: Surge in Immigration Cases in Minnesota Pushes Prosecutors and Judges to Brink
summary: Remarks by a prosecutor opened a revealing window onto how the courts in the state are buckling under the weight of a deluge of cases arising from the Trump administration’s campaign.

title: Major Nuclear Arms Treaty Expires, and Federal Prosecutor in Minnesota Says ‘This Job Sucks’
summary: Plus, Savannah Guthrie makes a plea to her mother’s abductor.

title: Brad Karp Resigns as Paul Weiss Chairman Amid Epstein Fallout
summary: The decision followed the release of a series of embarrassing emails between Mr. Karp and Jeffrey Epstein.

title: ‘My Crazy Friend’: The Royals Who Stayed Close to Epstein
summary: Emails, texts, photos and videos show how Jeffrey Epstein, even after becoming a convicted sex offender, burnished his ties to royal family members from several countries and their advisers.

title: Files Reveal Epstein’s Money Mingled with Silicon Valley’s Tech Start-Ups
summary: The disgraced financier regularly courted tech industry figures not just for their prestige but also for access to promising companies.

title: China’s Xi Presses Trump on Taiwan in Phone Call
summary: Both leaders gave versions of what they discussed, but the Chinese president’s take made clear the issue of the island was front and center.

title: How Trump Brought the Fight Over American History to Philadelphia
summary: The administration took a crowbar to a site that focused on George Washington and slavery. But can the contradictions of the Founding Era be erased?

title: Trump Says His Unpredictable Style Gives Him Leverage. But It Has a Cost.
summary: A year into President Trump’s second term, his threats, retreats, twists and turns appear to be wearing on allies and adversaries.

title: Jessie Diggins is the Olympian Testing the Limits of Endurance
summary: Jessie Diggins has become the best-ever American cross-country skier because of what she pushes her body through.

title: Residents of Cortina, a Winter Olympics Hub, Are Angry About All the Construction
summary: In Cortina d’Ampezzo, a hub for the Games in northern Italy, some residents, including a former Olympian, are annoyed about all the construction. Others are annoyed that they’re annoyed.

title: Savannah Guthrie Addresses Mother’s Abductor: ‘We Are Ready to Talk’
summary: Ms. Guthrie, the television anchor, and her siblings released a video on Wednesday night asking for proof that their mother, Nancy, is alive.

title: What to Know About the Disappearance of Savannah Guthrie’s Mom, Nancy
summary: Nancy Guthrie, 84, the “Today” show host’s mother, was last seen on Saturday night, the authorities said. The disappearance is being investigated as a possible kidnapping.

title: Venezuela Said to Detain Maduro Allies Targeted by the U.S.
summary: The questioning of the politically connected businessmen, Raúl Gorrín and Alex Saab, signaled deepening cooperation between the two nations.

title: ‘It’s Collective Punishment’: Iran Exacts Heavy Price on Protest Supporters
summary: The authorities are making mass arrests, seizing assets and hunting down doctors who treated protesters. Some Iranians keep showing defiance anyway.

title: U.S. and Iran to Hold Talks in Oman on Friday
summary: The White House confirmed a meeting would take place after days of conflicting reports on the talks’ timing, location and format.

title: To Win Back the House, Democrats Take the Fight to Deep-Red Areas
summary: Democrats are tapping candidates with unusual résumés — a Tejano recording star, a smokejumper and a fourth-generation farmer — to compete in areas long seen as inhospitable.

title: After Taking on Trump and Backing Mamdani, Hochul Sees Her Star Rise
summary: Gov. Kathy Hochul has warded off most serious challenges to her re-election, but still faces a primary contest against her lieutenant governor, Antonio Delgado.

title: Primary for New Jersey House Seat Is First Race of Pivotal Midterms
summary: Eleven candidates are running in a special primary election on Thursday to fill Gov. Mikie Sherrill’s former seat. They include a former member of Congress and the former lieutenant governor.

title: Newsom, Shapiro and Other Democrats Whip Up the 2028 Book Buzz
summary: A number of potential presidential candidates are releasing memoirs as the shadow primary heats up.

title: Bad Bunny Means a Breakthrough for Puerto Rican Athletes, Too
summary: Puerto Rican football players are thrilled that Spanish will resound at the Super Bowl. “The stage is bigger than the N.F.L. itself,” one lineman said.

title: William Shatner Pitches Raisin Bran in Super Bowl Commercial
summary: WK Kellogg is promoting Raisin Bran with William Shatner during the big game as cereal sales decline. It’s also tapping the latest health and wellness trend.

title: A 60-Year Arc at The Washington Post, From Watergate to the Weather
summary: Martin Weil, one of hundreds being laid off at The Post, has worked on local news there since 1965, witnessing the paper’s rise and now retrenchment.

title: When the Cold Turns Deadly, What Should New York City Do?
summary: Seventeen New Yorkers have died after exposure to frigid temperatures since Jan. 24, raising questions about how Mayor Zohran Mamdani has managed the crisis.

title: Trump Brings Out the Worst in Everyone
summary: Us included.

title: Maureen Dowd and Carlos Lozada on the Empty Propaganda of ‘Melania’
summary: Glamour, silence and a very big hat.

title: Jimmy Kimmel Hints ‘Melania’ Box Office Was a ‘Rigged Outcome’
summary: Late night hosts were skeptical of a $7 million opening weekend for the new Amazon film about the first lady.

title: Quick End to Second Day of Russia-Ukraine Peace Talks Hints at Impasse
summary: American negotiators trumpeted plans for a prisoner swap, but that was small recompense for months of diplomatic efforts by the Trump administration.

title: Nike, Accused of Bias Against White Workers, Is Under Federal Investigation
summary: It appeared to be the first time the Equal Employment Opportunity Commission has targeted diversity policies at a large company.

title: France’s Raid on X Escalates Trans-Atlantic Showdown Over Social Media
summary: The French investigation into Elon Musk’s X illustrated a fundamental divide between European and American leaders about how to regulate social media — or whether to restrict it at all.

title: Silver Is So Pricey That the World’s Largest Jeweler Is Switching to Platinum
summary: Pandora, known for its charm bracelets, is trying to reduce its exposure to the volatility in silver prices, the latest setback for a company also facing wary consumers and steep tariffs.
